`estimate` is a lightweight package helping with model-based estimations, used in the computation of marginal means, contrast analysis and predictions.


## Installation


Run the following:

```{r eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("easystats/estimate")
```
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library("estimate")
```

# Features

The package is built around 5 main functions:

- [`estimate_means()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/estimate_means.html): Estimates the average values at each factor levels
- [`estimate_contrasts()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/estimate_contrasts.html): Estimates and tests contrasts between different factor levels
- [`estimate_slopes()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/estimate_slopes.html): Estimates the slopes of numeric predictors at different factor levels
- [`estimate_response()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/estimate_response.html): Predict the response variable using the model
- [`estimate_smooth()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/estimate_smooth.html): Describes a non-linear term (*e.g.* in GAMs) by its linear parts

These functions are powered by the [`data_grid()`](https://easystats.github.io/estimate/reference/data_grid.html) function, a smart tool for guessing the appropriate reference grid.

The package currently only supports `rstanarm` models, but will be expanded to cover a large variety of frequentist and Bayesian models.

## Examples

### Estimate marginal means

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo = FALSE}
library(rstanarm)
library(ggplot2)
library(see)
library(estimate)

means <- estimate_means(stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species, data = iris, refresh = 0))

ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Width, fill = Species)) +
  geom_violin() +
  geom_jitter2(width = 0.05, alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_line(data = means, aes(y = Median, group = 1), size = 1) +
  geom_pointrange(data = means, aes(y = Median, ymin = CI_low, ymax = CI_high), size = 1, color = "white") +
  theme_modern()
```


```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
library(rstanarm)

model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species, data = iris)

estimate_means(model)
```
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(rstanarm)

model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species, data = iris, refresh = 0)

estimate_means(model)
```

### Contrast analysis
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
estimate_contrasts(model)
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(see)

plot(estimate_contrasts(model), estimate_means(model))
```

### Check the contrasts at different points of another linear predictor

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species * Petal.Length, data = iris)

estimate_contrasts(model, modulate = "Petal.Length", length = 3)
```
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species * Petal.Length, data = iris, refresh = 0)

estimate_contrasts(model, modulate = "Petal.Length", length = 3)
```



### Find a predictor's slopes at each factor level

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
estimate_slopes(model)
```


### Generate predictions from your model to compare it with original data
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
estimate_response(model)
```
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
knitr::kable(
  model %>% 
    estimate_response() %>% 
    head(), digits=2)
```

### Estimate the link between the response and a predictor

```{r echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', out.width="80%"}
knitr::include_graphics("https://github.com/easystats/estimate/raw/master/man/figures/gganimate_figure.gif")
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ poly(Petal.Length, 2), data=iris)

estimate_link(model)
```
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ poly(Petal.Length, 2), data=iris, refresh = 0)
knitr::kable(
  model %>% 
    estimate_link(length=7, smooth_strength = 0.3),
    digits=2)
```

### Describe the smooth term by its linear parts
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
estimate_smooth(model)
```
